 1004: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1005: disconnectfun_option_client(Config) ->
 1006:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1007:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1008: 
 1009:     Parent = self(),
 1010:     DisConnFun = fun(Reason) -> Parent ! {disconnect,Reason} end,
 1011: 
 1012:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1013: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1014: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1015: 					     {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1016:     _ConnectionRef =
 1017: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1018: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1019: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1020: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
 1021: 					  {user_interaction, false},
 1022: 					  {disconnectfun, DisConnFun}]),
 1023:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1024:     receive
 1025: 	{disconnect,Reason} ->
 1026: 	    ct:log("Client detected disconnect: ~p",[Reason]),
 1027: 	    ok
 1028:     after 3000 ->
 1029: 	    receive
 1030: 		X -> ct:log("received ~p",[X])
 1031: 	    after 0 -> ok
 1032: 	    end,
 1033: 	    {fail,"Timeout waiting for disconnect"}
 1034:     end.
 1035: 
 1036: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1037: unexpectedfun_option_server(Config) ->
 1038:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1039:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1040: 
 1041:     Parent = self(),
 1042:     ConnFun = fun(_,_,_) -> Parent ! {connection_pid,self()} end,
 1043:     UnexpFun = fun(Msg,Peer) ->
 1044: 		       Parent ! {unexpected,Msg,Peer,self()},
 1045: 		       skip
 1046: 	       end,
 1047: 
 1048:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1049: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1050: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1051: 					     {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
 1052: 					     {connectfun, ConnFun},
 1053: 					     {unexpectedfun, UnexpFun}]),
 1054:     _ConnectionRef =
 1055: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1056: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1057: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1058: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
 1059: 					  {user_interaction, false}]),
 1060:     receive
 1061: 	{connection_pid,Server} ->
 1062: 	    %% Beware, implementation knowledge:
 1063: 	    Server ! unexpected_message,
 1064: 	    receive
 1065: 		{unexpected, unexpected_message, {{_,_,_,_},_}, _} -> ok;
 1066: 		{unexpected, unexpected_message, Peer, _} -> ct:fail("Bad peer ~p",[Peer]);
 1067: 		M = {unexpected, _, _, _} -> ct:fail("Bad msg ~p",[M])
 1068: 	    after 3000 ->
 1069: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1070: 		    {fail,timeout2}
 1071: 	    end
 1072:     after 3000 ->
 1073: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1074: 	    {fail,timeout1}
 1075:     end.
 1076: 
 1077: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1078: unexpectedfun_option_client(Config) ->
 1079:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1080:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1081: 
 1082:     Parent = self(),
 1083:     UnexpFun = fun(Msg,Peer) -> 
 1084: 		       Parent ! {unexpected,Msg,Peer,self()},
 1085: 		       skip
 1086: 	       end,
 1087: 
 1088:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1089: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1090: 					     {password, "morot"},
 1091: 					     {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1092:     ConnectionRef =
 1093: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1094: 					  {user, "foo"},
 1095: 					  {password, "morot"},
 1096: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
 1097: 					  {user_interaction, false},
 1098: 					  {unexpectedfun, UnexpFun}]),
 1099:     %% Beware, implementation knowledge:
 1100:     ConnectionRef ! unexpected_message,
 1101: 
 1102:     receive
 1103: 	{unexpected, unexpected_message, {{_,_,_,_},_}, ConnectionRef} ->
 1104: 	    ok;
 1105: 	{unexpected, unexpected_message, Peer, ConnectionRef} ->
 1106: 	    ct:fail("Bad peer ~p",[Peer]);
 1107: 	M = {unexpected, _, _, _} ->
 1108: 	    ct:fail("Bad msg ~p",[M])
 1109:     after 3000 ->
 1110: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1111: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1112:     end.
 1113: 
 1114: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1115: hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config) ->
 1116:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, old).
 1117: 
 1118: hostkey_fingerprint_check_md5(Config) ->
 1119:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, md5).
 1120: 
 1121: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha(Config) ->
 1122:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha).
 1123: 
 1124: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha256(Config) ->
 1125:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha256).
 1126: 
 1127: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha384(Config) ->
 1128:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha384).
 1129: 
 1130: hostkey_fingerprint_check_sha512(Config) ->
 1131:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, sha512).
 1132: 
 1133: hostkey_fingerprint_check_list(Config) ->
 1134:     do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, [sha,md5,sha256]).
 1135: 
 1136: %%%----
 1137: do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg) ->
 1138:     case supported_hash(HashAlg) of
 1139: 	true ->
 1140: 	    really_do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg);
 1141: 	false when HashAlg == old ->
 1142: 	    {skip,{unsupported_hash,md5}};% Happen to know that ssh:hostkey_fingerprint/1 uses md5...
 1143: 	false ->
 1144: 	    {skip,{unsupported_hash,HashAlg}}
 1145:     end.
 1146: 
 1147: supported_hash(old) ->
 1148:     supported_hash(md5); % Happen to know that ssh:hostkey_fingerprint/1 uses md5...
 1149: supported_hash(HashAlg) ->
 1150:     Hs = if is_atom(HashAlg) -> [HashAlg];
 1151:             is_list(HashAlg) -> HashAlg
 1152:          end,
 1153:     [] == (Hs -- proplists:get_value(hashs, crypto:supports(), [])).
 1154: 
 1155: 
 1156: really_do_hostkey_fingerprint_check(Config, HashAlg) ->
 1157:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1158:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1159: 
 1160:     %% All host key fingerprints.  Trust that public_key has checked the hostkey_fingerprint
 1161:     %% function since that function is used by the ssh client...
 1162:     FPs0 = [case HashAlg of
 1163: 	       old -> ssh:hostkey_fingerprint(Key);
 1164: 	       _ -> ssh:hostkey_fingerprint(HashAlg, Key)
 1165: 	   end
 1166: 	   || FileCandidate <- begin
 1167: 				   {ok,KeyFileCands} = file:list_dir(SysDir),
 1168: 				   KeyFileCands
 1169: 			       end,
 1170: 	      nomatch =/= re:run(FileCandidate, ".*\\.pub", []),
 1171: 	      {Key,_Cmnts} <- begin
 1172: 				  {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(filename:join(SysDir, FileCandidate)),
 1173: 				  try ssh_file:decode(Bin, public_key)
 1174: 				  catch
 1175: 				      _:_ -> []
 1176: 				  end
 1177: 			      end],
 1178:     FPs = if is_atom(HashAlg) -> FPs0;
 1179:              is_list(HashAlg) -> lists:concat(FPs0)
 1180:           end,
 1181:     ct:log("Fingerprints(~p) = ~p",[HashAlg,FPs]),
 1182: 
 1183:     %% Start daemon with the public keys that we got fingerprints from
 1184:     {Pid, Host0, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1185: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1186: 					     {password, "morot"}]),
 1187:     Host = ssh_test_lib:ntoa(Host0),
 1188:     FP_check_fun = fun(PeerName, FP) ->
 1189: 			   ct:log("PeerName = ~p, FP = ~p",[PeerName,FP]),
 1190: 			   HostCheck = ssh_test_lib:match_ip(Host, PeerName),
 1191: 			   FPCheck = 
 1192:                                if is_atom(HashAlg) -> lists:member(FP, FPs);
 1193:                                   is_list(HashAlg) -> lists:all(fun(FP1) -> lists:member(FP1,FPs) end,
 1194:                                                                 FP)
 1195:                                end,
 1196: 			   ct:log("check ~p == ~p (~p) and ~n~p~n in ~p (~p)~n",
 1197: 				  [PeerName,Host,HostCheck,FP,FPs,FPCheck]),
 1198: 			   HostCheck and FPCheck
 1199: 		   end,
 1200:     
 1201:     ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts,
 1202: 				       case HashAlg of
 1203: 					   old -> FP_check_fun;
 1204: 					   _ -> {HashAlg, FP_check_fun}
 1205: 				       end},
 1206: 				      {user, "foo"},
 1207: 				      {password, "morot"},
 1208: 				      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1209:                                       {save_accepted_host, false}, % Ensure no 'known_hosts' disturbs
 1210: 				      {user_interaction, false}]),
 1211:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1212: 
 1213: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1214: %%% Test connect_timeout option in ssh:connect/4
 1215: ssh_connect_timeout(_Config) ->
 1216:     ConnTimeout = 2000,
 1217:     {error,{faked_transport,connect,TimeoutToTransport}} = 
 1218: 	ssh:connect("localhost", 12345, 
 1219: 		    [{transport,{tcp,?MODULE,tcp_closed}},
 1220:                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1221: 		     {connect_timeout,ConnTimeout}],
 1222: 		    1000),
 1223:     case TimeoutToTransport of
 1224: 	ConnTimeout -> ok;
 1225: 	Other -> 
 1226: 	    ct:log("connect_timeout is ~p but transport received ~p",[ConnTimeout,Other]),
 1227: 	    {fail,"ssh:connect/4 wrong connect_timeout received in transport"}
 1228:     end.
 1229:     
 1230: %% Plugin function for the test above
 1231: connect(_Host, _Port, _Opts, Timeout) ->
 1232:     {error, {faked_transport,connect,Timeout}}.
 1233: 
 1234: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1235: %%% Test fourth argument in ssh:connect/4
 1236: ssh_connect_arg4_timeout(_Config) ->
 1237:     Timeout = 1000,
 1238:     Parent = self(),
 1239:     %% start the server
 1240:     Server = spawn(fun() ->
 1241: 			   {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0,[]),
 1242: 			   {ok,{_,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
 1243: 			   Parent ! {port,self(),Port},
 1244: 			   Rsa = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 1245: 			   ct:log("Server gen_tcp:accept got ~p",[Rsa]),
 1246: 			   receive after 2*Timeout -> ok end %% let client timeout first
 1247: 		   end),
 1248: 
 1249:     %% Get listening port
 1250:     Port = receive
 1251: 	       {port,Server,ServerPort} -> ServerPort
 1252: 	   after 
 1253: 	       10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1254: 	   end,
 1255: 
 1256:     %% try to connect with a timeout, but "supervise" it
 1257:     Client = spawn(fun() ->
 1258: 			   T0 = erlang:monotonic_time(),
 1259: 			   Rc = ssh:connect("localhost",Port,[{save_accepted_host, false}],Timeout),
 1260: 			   ct:log("Client ssh:connect got ~p",[Rc]),
 1261: 			   Parent ! {done,self(),Rc,T0}
 1262: 		   end),
 1263: 
 1264:     %% Wait for client reaction on the connection try:
 1265:     receive
 1266: 	{done, Client, {error,timeout}, T0} ->
 1267: 	    Msp = ms_passed(T0),
 1268: 	    exit(Server,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1269: 	    Low = 0.9*Timeout,
 1270: 	    High =  4.0*Timeout,
 1271: 	    ct:log("Timeout limits: ~.4f - ~.4f ms, timeout "
 1272:                    "was ~.4f ms, expected ~p ms",[Low,High,Msp,Timeout]),
 1273: 	    if
 1274: 		Low<Msp, Msp<High -> ok;
 1275: 		true -> {fail, "timeout not within limits"}
 1276: 	    end;
 1277: 
 1278: 	{done, Client, {error,Other}, _T0} ->
 1279: 	    ct:log("Error message \"~p\" from the client is unexpected.",[{error,Other}]),
 1280: 	    {fail, "Unexpected error message"};
 1281: 
 1282: 	{done, Client, {ok,_Ref}, _T0} ->
 1283: 	    {fail,"ssh-connected ???"}
 1284:     after
 1285: 	5000 ->
 1286: 	    exit(Server,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1287: 	    exit(Client,hasta_la_vista___baby),
 1288: 	    {fail, "Didn't timeout"}
 1289:     end.
 1290: 
 1291: %% Help function, elapsed milliseconds since T0
 1292: ms_passed(T0) ->
 1293:     %% OTP 18
 1294:     erlang:convert_time_unit(erlang:monotonic_time() - T0,
 1295: 			     native,
 1296: 			     micro_seconds) / 1000.
 1297: 
 1298: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1299: ssh_daemon_minimal_remote_max_packet_size_option(Config) ->
 1300:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1301:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config), 
 1302:     
 1303:     {Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},
 1304: 						{user_dir, UserDir},
 1305: 						{user_passwords, [{"vego", "morot"}]},
 1306: 						{failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2},
 1307: 						{minimal_remote_max_packet_size, 14}]),
 1308:     Conn =
 1309: 	ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1310: 					  {user_dir, UserDir},
 1311: 					  {user_interaction, false},
 1312: 					  {user, "vego"},
 1313: 					  {password, "morot"}]),
 1314: 
 1315:     %% Try the limits of the minimal_remote_max_packet_size:
 1316:     {ok, _ChannelId} = ssh_connection:session_channel(Conn, 100, 14, infinity),
 1317:     {open_error,_,"Maximum packet size below 14 not supported",_} = 
 1318: 	ssh_connection:session_channel(Conn, 100, 13, infinity),
 1319: 
 1320:     ssh:close(Conn),
 1321:     ssh:stop_daemon(Server).
 1322:     
 1323: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1324: %% This test try every algorithm by connecting to an Erlang server
 1325: id_string_no_opt_client(Config) ->
 1326:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1327:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1328:     receive
 1329: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Erlang/"++Vsn} ->
 1330: 	    true = expected_ssh_vsn(Vsn);
 1331: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1332: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1333:     after 5000 ->
 1334: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1335:     end.
 1336: 
 1337: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1338: id_string_own_string_client(Config) ->
 1339:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1340:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,"Pelle"},
 1341:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}
 1342:                                                ], 1000),
 1343:     receive
 1344: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Pelle\r\n"} ->
 1345: 	    ok;
 1346: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1347: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1348:     after 5000 ->
 1349: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1350:     end.
 1351: 
 1352: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1353: id_string_own_string_client_trail_space(Config) ->
 1354:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1355:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,"Pelle "},
 1356:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1357:     receive
 1358: 	{id,Server,"SSH-2.0-Pelle \r\n"} ->
 1359: 	    ok;
 1360: 	{id,Server,Other} ->
 1361: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Other])
 1362:     after 5000 ->
 1363: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1364:     end.
 1365: 
 1366: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1367: id_string_random_client(Config) ->
 1368:     {Server, _Host, Port} = fake_daemon(Config),
 1369:     {error,_} = ssh:connect("localhost", Port, [{id_string,random},
 1370:                                                 {save_accepted_host, false}], 1000),
 1371:     receive
 1372: 	{id,Server,Id="SSH-2.0-Erlang"++_} ->
 1373: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Id]);
 1374: 	{id,Server,Rnd="SSH-2.0-"++ID} when 4=<length(ID),length(ID)=<7 -> %% Add 2 for CRLF
 1375: 	    ct:log("Got correct ~s",[Rnd]);
 1376: 	{id,Server,Id} ->
 1377: 	    ct:fail("Unexpected id: ~s.",[Id])
 1378:     after 5000 ->
 1379: 	    {fail,timeout}
 1380:     end.
 1381: 
 1382: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1383: id_string_no_opt_server(Config) ->
 1384:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, []),
 1385:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1386:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Erlang/"++Vsn} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000),
 1387:     true = expected_ssh_vsn(Vsn).
 1388: 
 1389: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1390: id_string_own_string_server(Config) ->
 1391:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,"Olle"}]),
 1392:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1393:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Olle\r\n"} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000).
 1394: 
 1395: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1396: id_string_own_string_server_trail_space(Config) ->
 1397:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,"Olle "}]),
 1398:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1399:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-Olle \r\n"} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000).
 1400: 
 1401: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1402: id_string_random_server(Config) ->
 1403:     %% Check undocumented format of id_string. First a bad variant:
 1404:     {error,{eoptions,_}} = ssh:daemon(0, [{id_string,{random,8,6}}]),
 1405:     %% And then a correct one:
 1406:     {_Server, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config, [{id_string,{random,6,8}}]),
 1407:     {ok,S1}=ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host,Port,[{active,false},{packet,line}]),
 1408:     {ok,"SSH-2.0-"++Rnd} = gen_tcp:recv(S1, 0, 2000),
 1409:     case Rnd of
 1410: 	"Erlang"++_ -> ct:log("Id=~p",[Rnd]),
 1411: 		       {fail,got_default_id};
 1412: 	"Olle\r\n" -> {fail,got_previous_tests_value};
 1413: 	_ when 8=<length(Rnd),length(Rnd)=<10 -> %% Add 2 for CRLF
 1414: 	    ct:log("Got correct ~s",[Rnd]);
 1415: 	_ ->
 1416:             ct:log("Got wrong sized ~s.",[Rnd]),
 1417:             {fail,got_wrong_size}
 1418:     end.
 1419: 
 1420: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1421: ssh_connect_negtimeout_parallel(Config) -> ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config,true).
 1422: ssh_connect_negtimeout_sequential(Config) -> ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config,false).
 1423:     
 1424: ssh_connect_negtimeout(Config, Parallel) ->
 1425:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1426:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1427:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1428:     NegTimeOut = 2000,				% ms
 1429:     ct:log("Parallel: ~p",[Parallel]),
 1430: 
 1431:     {_Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},{user_dir, UserDir},
 1432:                                                {parallel_login, Parallel},
 1433:                                                {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1434:                                                {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1435: 
 1436:     {ok,Socket} = ssh_test_lib:gen_tcp_connect(Host, Port, []),
 1437: 
 1438:     Factor = 2,
 1439:     ct:log("And now sleeping ~p*NegTimeOut (~p ms)...", [Factor, round(Factor * NegTimeOut)]),
 1440:     ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1441:     
 1442:     case inet:sockname(Socket) of
 1443: 	{ok,_} -> 
 1444: 	    %% Give it another chance...
 1445: 	    ct:log("Sleep more...",[]),
 1446: 	    ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1447: 	    case inet:sockname(Socket) of
 1448: 		{ok,_} -> ct:fail("Socket not closed");
 1449: 		{error,_} -> ok
 1450: 	    end;
 1451: 	{error,_} -> ok
 1452:     end.
 1453: 
 1454: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1455: %%% Test that ssh connection does not timeout if the connection is established (parallel)
 1456: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected_parallel(Config) ->
 1457:     ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, true).
 1458: 
 1459: %%% Test that ssh connection does not timeout if the connection is established (non-parallel)
 1460: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected_sequential(Config) ->
 1461:     ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, false).
 1462: 
 1463: 
 1464: ssh_connect_nonegtimeout_connected(Config, Parallel) ->
 1465:     process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1466:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1467:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1468:     NegTimeOut = 2000,				% ms
 1469:     ct:log("Parallel: ~p",[Parallel]),
 1470:    
 1471:     {_Pid, _Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SystemDir},{user_dir, UserDir},
 1472: 					       {parallel_login, Parallel},
 1473: 					       {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1474: 					       {failfun, fun ssh_test_lib:failfun/2}]),
 1475:     ct:log("~p Listen ~p:~p",[_Pid,_Host,Port]),
 1476:     ct:sleep(500),
 1477: 
 1478:     IO = ssh_test_lib:start_io_server(),
 1479:     Shell = ssh_test_lib:start_shell(Port, IO, [{user_dir,UserDir}]),
 1480:     receive
 1481: 	Error = {'EXIT', _, _} ->
 1482: 	    ct:log("~p",[Error]),
 1483: 	    ct:fail(no_ssh_connection);  
 1484: 	ErlShellStart ->
 1485: 	    ct:log("---Erlang shell start: ~p~n", [ErlShellStart]),
 1486: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut),
 1487: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut),
 1488: 
 1489: 	    Factor = 2,
 1490: 	    ct:log("And now sleeping ~p*NegTimeOut (~p ms)...", [Factor, round(Factor * NegTimeOut)]),
 1491: 	    ct:sleep(round(Factor * NegTimeOut)),
 1492:     
 1493: 	    one_shell_op(IO, NegTimeOut)
 1494:     after 
 1495: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 1496:     end,
 1497:     exit(Shell, kill).
 1498: 
 1499: 
 1500: one_shell_op(IO, TimeOut) ->
 1501:     ct:log("One shell op: Waiting for prompter"),
 1502:     receive
 1503: 	ErlPrompt0 -> ct:log("Erlang prompt: ~p~n", [ErlPrompt0])
 1504:     after TimeOut -> ct:fail("Timeout waiting for promter")
 1505:     end,
 1506: 
 1507:     IO ! {input, self(), "2*3*7.\r\n"},
 1508:     receive
 1509: 	Result0 -> ct:log("Result: ~p~n", [Result0])
 1510:     after TimeOut ->  ct:fail("Timeout waiting for result")
 1511:     end.
 1512: 
 1513: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1514: max_log_item_len(Config) ->
 1515:     %% Find a supported algorithm (to be removed from the daemon):
 1516:     {ok, {Type,Alg}} = select_alg( ssh:default_algorithms() ),
 1517: 
 1518:     %% Start a test daemon without support for {Type,Alg}
 1519:     SystemDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1520:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1521:     {_Pid, Host0, Port} =
 1522:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1523:                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1524:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1525:                              {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1526:                              {modify_algorithms, [{rm, [{Type,[Alg]}]}]},
 1527:                              {max_log_item_len, 10}
 1528:                             ]),
 1529:     Host = ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(Host0),
 1530:     ct:log("~p:~p Listen ~p:~p. Mangled Host = ~p",
 1531:            [?MODULE,?LINE,Host0,Port,Host]),
 1532: 
 1533:     {ok,ReportHandlerPid} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:add_report_handler(),
 1534: 
 1535:     %% Connect to it with the {Type,Alg} to force a failure and log entry:
 1536:     {error,_} = R =
 1537:         ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1538:                     [{preferred_algorithms, [{Type,[Alg]}]},
 1539:                      {max_log_item_len, 10},
 1540:                      {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1541:                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1542:                      {user_dir, UserDir},
 1543:                      {user_interaction, false},
 1544:                      {user, "carni"},
 1545:                      {password, "meat"}
 1546:                     ]),
 1547: 
 1548:     {ok, Reports} = ssh_eqc_event_handler:get_reports(ReportHandlerPid),
 1549:     ct:log("~p:~p ssh:connect -> ~p~n~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,R,Reports]),
 1550: 
 1551:     [ok] =
 1552:         lists:usort(
 1553:           [check_skip_part(
 1554:              string:tokens(
 1555:                lists:flatten(io_lib:format(Fmt,Args)),
 1556:                " \n"))
 1557:            || {info_msg,_,{_,Fmt,Args}} <- Reports]
 1558:           ).
 1559: 
 1560: 
 1561: check_skip_part(["Disconnect","...","("++_NumSkipped, "bytes","skipped)"]) ->
 1562:     ok;
 1563: check_skip_part([_|T]) ->
 1564:     check_skip_part(T);
 1565: check_skip_part([]) ->
 1566:     error.
 1567: 
 1568: select_alg([{Type,[A,_|_]}|_]) when is_atom(A) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1569: select_alg([{Type,[{Dir,[A,_|_]}, _]}|_]) when is_atom(A), is_atom(Dir) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1570: select_alg([{Type,[_,{Dir,[A,_|_]}]}|_]) when is_atom(A), is_atom(Dir) -> {ok, {Type,A}};
 1571: select_alg([_|Algs]) -> select_alg(Algs);
 1572: select_alg([]) -> false.
 1573: 
 1574: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1575: max_sessions_ssh_connect_parallel(Config) -> 
 1576:     max_sessions(Config, true, connect_fun(ssh__connect,Config)).
 1577: max_sessions_ssh_connect_sequential(Config) -> 
 1578:     max_sessions(Config, false, connect_fun(ssh__connect,Config)).
 1579: 
 1580: max_sessions_sftp_start_channel_parallel(Config) -> 
 1581:     max_sessions(Config, true, connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, Config)).
 1582: max_sessions_sftp_start_channel_sequential(Config) -> 
 1583:     max_sessions(Config, false, connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, Config)).
 1584: 
 1585: 
 1586: %%%---- helpers:
 1587: connect_fun(ssh__connect, Config) ->
 1588:     fun(Host,Port) ->
 1589: 	    ssh_test_lib:connect(Host, Port, 
 1590: 				 [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1591: 				  {user_dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
 1592: 				  {user_interaction, false},
 1593: 				  {user, "carni"},
 1594: 				  {password, "meat"}
 1595: 				 ])
 1596: 	    %% ssh_test_lib returns R when ssh:connect returns {ok,R}
 1597:     end;
 1598: connect_fun(ssh_sftp__start_channel, _Config) ->
 1599:     fun(Host,Port) ->
 1600: 	    {ok,_Pid,ConnRef} =
 1601: 		ssh_sftp:start_channel(Host, Port, 
 1602: 				       [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1603:                                         {save_accepted_host, false},
 1604: 					{user, "carni"},
 1605: 					{password, "meat"}
 1606: 				       ]),
 1607: 	    ConnRef
 1608:     end.
 1609: 
 1610: 
 1611: max_sessions(Config, ParallelLogin, Connect0) when is_function(Connect0,2) ->
 1612:     Connect = fun(Host,Port) ->
 1613: 		      R = Connect0(Host,Port),
 1614: 		      ct:log("Connect(~p,~p) -> ~p",[Host,Port,R]),
 1615: 		      R
 1616: 	      end,
 1617:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1618:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1619:     MaxSessions = 5,
 1620:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1621: 					     {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1622: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1623: 					     {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1624: 					     {parallel_login, ParallelLogin},
 1625: 					     {max_sessions, MaxSessions}
 1626: 					    ]),
 1627:     ct:log("~p Listen ~p:~p for max ~p sessions",[Pid,Host,Port,MaxSessions]),
 1628:     try [Connect(Host,Port) || _ <- lists:seq(1,MaxSessions)]
 1629:     of
 1630: 	Connections ->
 1631: 	    %% Step 1 ok: could set up max_sessions connections
 1632: 	    ct:log("Connections up: ~p",[Connections]),
 1633: 	    [_|_] = Connections,
 1634: 
 1635: 	    %% N w try one more than allowed:
 1636: 	    ct:log("Info Report expected here (if not disabled) ...",[]),
 1637: 	    try Connect(Host,Port)
 1638: 	    of
 1639: 		_ConnectionRef1 ->
 1640: 		    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1641: 		    {fail,"Too many connections accepted"}
 1642: 	    catch
 1643: 		error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1644:                     ct:log("Step 2 ok: could not set up too many connections. Good.",[]),
 1645: 		    %% Now stop one connection and try to open one more
 1646: 		    ok = ssh:close(hd(Connections)),
 1647: 		    try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid)
 1648: 	    end
 1649:     catch
 1650: 	error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1651: 	    ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1652: 	    {fail,"Too few connections accepted"}
 1653:     end.
 1654: 
 1655: 
 1656: try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid) ->
 1657:     {ok,Tref} = timer:send_after(30000, timeout_no_connection), % give the supervisors some time...
 1658:     try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, 1). % will take max 3300 ms after 11 tries
 1659: 
 1660: try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, N) ->
 1661:      try Connect(Host,Port)
 1662:      of
 1663: 	 _ConnectionRef1 ->
 1664: 	     timer:cancel(Tref),
 1665:              ct:log("Step 3 ok: could set up one more connection after killing one. That's good.",[]),
 1666: 	     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1667: 	     receive % flush. 
 1668: 		 timeout_no_connection -> ok
 1669: 	     after 0 -> ok
 1670: 	     end
 1671:      catch
 1672: 	 error:{badmatch,{error,"Connection closed"}} ->
 1673: 	     %% Could not set up one more connection. Try again until timeout.
 1674: 	     receive
 1675: 		 timeout_no_connection ->
 1676: 		     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid),
 1677: 		     {fail,"Does not decrease # active sessions"}
 1678: 	     after N*50 -> % retry after this time
 1679: 		     try_to_connect(Connect, Host, Port, Pid, Tref, N+1)
 1680: 	     end
 1681:      end.
 1682: 
 1683: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1684: max_sessions_drops_tcp_connects() ->
 1685:     [{timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
 1686: 
 1687: max_sessions_drops_tcp_connects(Config) ->
 1688:     MaxSessions = 20,
 1689:     UseSessions = 2, % Must be =< MaxSessions
 1690:     FloodSessions = 1000,
 1691:     ParallelLogin = true,
 1692:     NegTimeOut = 8*1000,
 1693:     HelloTimeOut = 200,
 1694: 
 1695:     %% Start a test daemon
 1696:     SystemDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), system),
 1697:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 1698:     {Pid, Host0, Port} =
 1699:         ssh_test_lib:daemon([
 1700:                              {system_dir, SystemDir},
 1701:                              {user_dir, UserDir},
 1702:                              {user_passwords, [{"carni", "meat"}]},
 1703:                              {parallel_login, ParallelLogin},
 1704:                              {hello_timeout, HelloTimeOut},
 1705:                              {negotiation_timeout, NegTimeOut},
 1706:                              {max_sessions, MaxSessions}
 1707:                             ]),
 1708:     Host = ssh_test_lib:mangle_connect_address(Host0),
 1709:     ct:log("~p:~p ~p Listen ~p:~p for max ~p sessions. Mangled Host = ~p",
 1710:            [?MODULE,?LINE,Pid,Host0,Port,MaxSessions,Host]),
 1711:     
 1712:     %% Log in UseSessions connections
 1713:     SSHconnect = fun(N) ->
 1714:                          R = ssh:connect(Host, Port, 
 1715:                                          [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1716:                                           {save_accepted_host, false},
 1717:                                           {user_dir, proplists:get_value(priv_dir,Config)},
 1718:                                           {user_interaction, false},
 1719:                                           {user, "carni"},
 1720:                                           {password, "meat"}
 1721:                                          ]),
 1722:                          ct:log("~p:~p ~p: ssh:connect -> ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,N,R]),
 1723:                          R
 1724:                  end,
 1725: 
 1726:     L1 = oks([SSHconnect(N) || N <- lists:seq(1,UseSessions)]),
 1727:     case length(L1) of
 1728:         UseSessions ->
 1729:             %% As expected
 1730:             %% Try gen_tcp:connect
 1731:             [ct:log("~p:~p ~p: gen_tcp:connect -> ~p", 
 1732:                     [?MODULE,?LINE, N, gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [])])
 1733:              || N <- lists:seq(UseSessions+1, MaxSessions)
 1734:             ],
 1735: 
 1736:             ct:log("~p:~p Now try ~p gen_tcp:connect to be rejected", [?MODULE,?LINE,FloodSessions]),
 1737:             [ct:log("~p:~p ~p: gen_tcp:connect -> ~p", 
 1738:                     [?MODULE,?LINE, N, gen_tcp:connect(Host, Port, [])])
 1739:              || N <- lists:seq(MaxSessions+1, MaxSessions+1+FloodSessions)
 1740:             ],
 1741:             
 1742:             ct:log("~p:~p try ~p ssh:connect", [?MODULE,?LINE, MaxSessions - UseSessions]),
 1743:             try_ssh_connect(MaxSessions - UseSessions, NegTimeOut, SSHconnect);
 1744: 
 1745:         Len1 ->
 1746:             {fail, Len1}
 1747:     end.
 1748: 
 1749: try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F) when N>0 ->
 1750:     case F(N) of
 1751:         {ok,_} ->
 1752:             try_ssh_connect(N-1, NegTimeOut, F);
 1753:         {error,_} when N==1 ->
 1754:             try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F);
 1755:         {error,_} ->
 1756:             timer:sleep(NegTimeOut),
 1757:             try_ssh_connect(N, NegTimeOut, F)
 1758:     end;
 1759: try_ssh_connect(_N, _NegTimeOut, _F) ->
 1760:     done.
 1761: 
 1762: 
 1763: oks(L) -> lists:filter(fun({ok,_}) -> true;
 1764:                           (_) -> false
 1765:                        end, L).
 1766:     
 1767: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1768: save_accepted_host_option(Config) ->
 1769:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1770:     KnownHosts = filename:join(UserDir, "known_hosts"),
 1771:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),	  
 1772:     {Pid, Host, Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1773: 					     {user_dir, UserDir},
 1774: 					     {user_passwords, [{"vego", "morot"}]}
 1775:                                             ]),
 1776:     {error,enoent} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1777: 
 1778:     {ok,_C1} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1779:                                         {save_accepted_host, false},
 1780:                                         {user, "vego"},
 1781:                                         {password, "morot"},
 1782:                                         {user_interaction, false},
 1783:                                         {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1784:     {error,enoent} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1785:     
 1786:     {ok,_C2} = ssh:connect(Host, Port, [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1787:                                         {user, "vego"},
 1788:                                         {password, "morot"},
 1789:                                         {user_interaction, false},
 1790:                                         {user_dir, UserDir}]),
 1791:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(KnownHosts),
 1792:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 1793: 
 1794: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1795: raw_option(_Config) ->
 1796:     Opts = [{raw,1,2,3,4}],
 1797:     #{socket_options := Opts} = ssh_options:handle_options(client, Opts),
 1798:     #{socket_options := Opts} = ssh_options:handle_options(server, Opts).
 1799: 
 1800: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1801: config_file(Config) ->
 1802:     %% First find common algs:
 1803:     ServerAlgs = ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd),
 1804:     OurAlgs = ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(), % Incl disabled but supported
 1805:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:intersection(ServerAlgs, OurAlgs),
 1806:     ct:log("ServerAlgs =~n~p~n~nOurAlgs =~n~p~n~nCommonAlgs =~n~p",[ServerAlgs,OurAlgs,CommonAlgs]),   
 1807:     Nkex = length(proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs, [])),
 1808: 
 1809:     %% Adjust for very old ssh daemons that only supports ssh-rsa and ssh-dss:
 1810:     AdjustClient =
 1811:         case proplists:get_value(public_key,ServerAlgs,[]) -- ['ssh-rsa','ssh-dss'] of
 1812:             [] ->
 1813:                 %% Old, let the client support them also:
 1814:                 ct:log("Adjust the client's public_key set", []),
 1815:                 [{public_key, ['ssh-rsa','ssh-dss']}];
 1816:             [_|_] ->
 1817:                 %% Ok, let the client be un-modified:
 1818:                 []
 1819:         end,
 1820: 
 1821:     case {ServerAlgs, ssh_test_lib:some_empty(CommonAlgs)} of
 1822:         {[],_} ->
 1823:             {skip, "No server algorithms found"};
 1824:         {_,true} ->
 1825:             {fail, "Missing common algorithms"};
 1826:         _ when Nkex<3 ->
 1827:             {skip, "Not enough number of common kex"};
 1828:         _ ->
 1829:             %% Then find three common kex and one common cipher:
 1830:             [K1a,K1b,K2a|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs),
 1831:             [{_,[Ch1|_]}|_] = proplists:get_value(cipher, CommonAlgs),
 1832: 
 1833:             %% Make config file:
 1834:             {ok,ConfFile} = 
 1835:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1836:                   "c2.config", Config,
 1837:                   [{ssh, [{preferred_algorithms,
 1838:                            [{cipher, [Ch1]},
 1839:                             {kex,    [K1a]}
 1840:                            ] ++ AdjustClient},
 1841:                           {client_options,
 1842:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1843:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1a]}]},
 1844:                               {append, [{kex, [K1b]}]}
 1845:                              ]}
 1846:                            ]}
 1847:                          ]}
 1848:                   ]),
 1849: 
 1850:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 1851:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 1852: 
 1853:             R0 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1854:             ct:log("R0 = ~p",[R0]),
 1855:             R0 = ssh:default_algorithms(),
 1856: 
 1857:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 1858:             rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 1859: 
 1860:             R1 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1861:             ct:log("R1 = ~p",[R1]),
 1862:             [{kex,[K1a]},
 1863:              {public_key,_},
 1864:              {cipher,[{_,[Ch1]},
 1865:                       {_,[Ch1]}]} | _] = R1,
 1866: 
 1867:             %% First connection. The client_options should be applied:
 1868:             {ok,C1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connect, [loopback, ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT,
 1869:                                                     [{silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1870:                                                      {save_accepted_host, false},
 1871:                                                      {user_interaction, false}
 1872:                                                     ]]),
 1873:             ct:log("C1 = ~n~p", [C1]),
 1874:             {algorithms,As1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C1, algorithms]),
 1875:             K1b = proplists:get_value(kex, As1),
 1876:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(encrypt, As1),
 1877:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(decrypt, As1),
 1878:             {options,Os1} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C1, options]),
 1879:             ct:log("C1 algorithms:~n~p~n~noptions:~n~p", [As1,Os1]),
 1880: 
 1881:             %% Second connection, the Options take precedence:
 1882:             C2_Opts = [{modify_algorithms,[{rm,[{kex,[K1b]}]}, % N.B.
 1883:                                            {append, [{kex,[K2a]}]}]},
 1884:                        {silently_accept_hosts, true},
 1885:                        {save_accepted_host, false},
 1886:                        {user_interaction, false}
 1887:                       ],
 1888:             {ok,C2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connect, [loopback, ?SSH_DEFAULT_PORT, C2_Opts]),
 1889:             {algorithms,As2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C2, algorithms]),
 1890:             K2a = proplists:get_value(kex, As2),
 1891:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(encrypt, As2),
 1892:             Ch1 = proplists:get_value(decrypt, As2),
 1893:             {options,Os2} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C2, options]),
 1894:             ct:log("C2 opts:~n~p~n~nalgorithms:~n~p~n~noptions:~n~p", [C2_Opts,As2,Os2]),
 1895: 
 1896:             peer:stop(Peer)
 1897:     end.
 1898:     
 1899: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------
 1900: config_file_modify_algorithms_order(Config) ->
 1901:     %% First find common algs:
 1902:     ServerAlgs = ssh_test_lib:default_algorithms(sshd),
 1903:     OurAlgs = ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(), % Incl disabled but supported
 1904:     CommonAlgs = ssh_test_lib:intersection(ServerAlgs, OurAlgs),
 1905:     ct:log("ServerAlgs =~n~p~n~nOurAlgs =~n~p~n~nCommonAlgs =~n~p",[ServerAlgs,OurAlgs,CommonAlgs]),
 1906:     Nkex = length(proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs, [])),
 1907:     case {ServerAlgs, ssh_test_lib:some_empty(CommonAlgs)} of
 1908:         {[],_} ->
 1909:             {skip, "No server algorithms found"};
 1910:         {_,true} ->
 1911:             {fail, "Missing common algorithms"};
 1912:         _ when Nkex<3 ->
 1913:             {skip, "Not enough number of common kex"};
 1914:         _ ->
 1915:             %% Then find three common kex and one common cipher:
 1916:             [K1,K2,K3|_] = proplists:get_value(kex, CommonAlgs),
 1917:             [{_,[Ch1|_]}|_] = proplists:get_value(cipher, CommonAlgs),
 1918: 
 1919:             %% Make config file:
 1920:             {ok, ConfFile} =
 1921:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 1922:                   "c3.config", Config,
 1923:                   [{ssh, [{preferred_algorithms,
 1924:                            [{cipher, [Ch1]},
 1925:                             {kex,    [K1]}
 1926:                            ]},
 1927:                           {server_options,
 1928:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1929:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1]}]},
 1930:                               {append, [{kex, [K2]}]}
 1931:                              ]}
 1932:                            ]},
 1933:                           {client_options,
 1934:                            [{modify_algorithms,
 1935:                              [{rm,     [{kex, [K1]}]},
 1936:                               {append, [{kex, [K3]}]}
 1937:                              ]}
 1938:                            ]}
 1939:                          ]}
 1940:                   ]),
 1941: 
 1942:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 1943:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 1944:     
 1945:             R0 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1946:             ct:log("R0 = ~p",[R0]),
 1947:             R0 = ssh:default_algorithms(),
 1948: 
 1949:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 1950:             ok = rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 1951:             R1 = rpc:call(Node, ssh, default_algorithms, []),
 1952:             ct:log("R1 = ~p",[R1]),
 1953:             [{kex,[K1]} | _] = R1,
 1954: 
 1955:             %% Start a daemon
 1956:             {Server, Host, Port} = rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_daemon, [Config, []]),
 1957:             {ok,ServerInfo} = rpc:call(Node, ssh, daemon_info, [Server]),
 1958:             ct:log("ServerInfo =~n~p", [ServerInfo]),
 1959: 
 1960:             %% Test that the server_options env key works:
 1961:             [K2] = proplists:get_value(kex,
 1962:                    proplists:get_value(preferred_algorithms,
 1963:                    proplists:get_value(options, ServerInfo))),
 1964:             
 1965:             {badrpc, {'EXIT', {{badmatch,ExpectedError}, _}}} =
 1966:                 %% No common kex algorithms expected. 
 1967:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_connect, [Config, Host, Port, []]), 
 1968:             {error,"Key exchange failed"} = ExpectedError,
 1969: 
 1970:             C = rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, std_connect,
 1971:                          [Config, Host, Port, 
 1972:                           [{modify_algorithms,[{append,[{kex,[K2]}]}]}]]),
 1973:             ConnInfo = rpc:call(Node, ssh, connection_info, [C]),
 1974:             ct:log("ConnInfo =~n~p", [ConnInfo]),
 1975:             Algs = proplists:get_value(algorithms, ConnInfo),
 1976:             ct:log("Algs =~n~p", [Algs]),
 1977:             ConnOptions = proplists:get_value(options, ConnInfo),
 1978:             ConnPrefAlgs = proplists:get_value(preferred_algorithms, ConnOptions),
 1979: 
 1980:             %% And now, are all levels applied in right order:
 1981:             [K3,K2] = proplists:get_value(kex, ConnPrefAlgs),
 1982: 
 1983:             peer:stop(Peer)
 1984:     end.
 1985: 
 1986:     
 1987: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 1988: daemon_replace_options_simple(Config) ->
 1989:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1990: 
 1991:     UserDir1 = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 1992:     UserDir2 = filename:join(UserDir1, "foo"),
 1993:     file:make_dir(UserDir2),
 1994: 
 1995:     {Pid, _Host, _Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 1996:                                                {user_dir, UserDir1}
 1997:                                               ]),
 1998:     {ok,Opts1} = ssh:daemon_info(Pid),
 1999:     UserDir1 = proplists:get_value(user_dir, proplists:get_value(options,Opts1,[])),
 2000: 
 2001:     {ok, Pid} = ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{user_dir,UserDir2}]),
 2002:     {ok,Opts2} = ssh:daemon_info(Pid),
 2003:     case proplists:get_value(user_dir, proplists:get_value(options,Opts2,[])) of
 2004:         UserDir2 ->
 2005:             ok;
 2006:         UserDir1 ->
 2007:             ct:log("~p:~p Got old value ~p~nExpected ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,UserDir1,UserDir2]),
 2008:             {fail, "Not changed"};
 2009:         Other ->
 2010:             ct:log("~p:~p Got ~p~nExpected ~p", [?MODULE,?LINE,Other,UserDir2]),
 2011:             {fail, "Strange value"}
 2012:     end.
 2013: 
 2014: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2015: daemon_replace_options_algs(Config) ->
 2016:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2017:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 2018: 
 2019:     DefaultKex =
 2020:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 2021:     NonDefaultKex =
 2022:         ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(kex) -- DefaultKex,
 2023: 
 2024:     case NonDefaultKex of
 2025:         [A1|_] ->
 2026:             [A2,A3|_] = DefaultKex,
 2027:             {Pid, _Host, _Port} = ssh_test_lib:daemon([{system_dir, SysDir},
 2028:                                                        {user_dir, UserDir},
 2029:                                                        {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2030:                                                       ]),
 2031:             [A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 2032:             {ok, Pid} =
 2033:                 ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{modify_algorithms,
 2034:                                                   [{prepend,[{kex,[A2]}]}]
 2035:                                                  }
 2036:                                                 ]),
 2037:             [A2,A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 2038: 
 2039:             {ok, Pid} =
 2040:                 ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid, [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A3]}]
 2041:                                                  }
 2042:                                                 ]),
 2043:             [A2,A3] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex)
 2044:             ;
 2045:         [] ->
 2046:             {skip, "No non-default kex"}
 2047:     end.
 2048: 
 2049: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2050: daemon_replace_options_algs_connect(Config) ->
 2051:     [A1,A2|_] =
 2052:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 2053: 
 2054:     {Pid, Host, Port} =
 2055:         ssh_test_lib:std_daemon(Config,
 2056:                                 [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2057:                                 ]),
 2058:     [A1] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 2059: 
 2060:     %% Open a connection with A1 as kex and test it
 2061:     C1 =
 2062:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 2063:                                  [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2064:                                  ]),
 2065:     ok = test_connection(C1),
 2066:     ok = test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 2067:                           [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}
 2068:                           ]),
 2069: 
 2070:     %% Change kex to A2
 2071:     {ok, Pid} =
 2072:         ssh:daemon_replace_options(Pid,
 2073:                                    [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}]),
 2074:     [A2] = get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, kex),
 2075: 
 2076:     %% and open the second connection with this kex, and test it
 2077:     C2 =
 2078:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 2079:                                  [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A2]}]}
 2080:                                  ]),
 2081:     ok = test_connection(C2),
 2082:     ok = test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port,
 2083:                           [{preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2084:                           ]),
 2085: 
 2086:     %% Test that the first connection is still alive:
 2087:     ok = test_connection(C1),
 2088: 
 2089:     ssh:close(C1),
 2090:     ssh:close(C2),
 2091:     ssh:stop_daemon(Pid).
 2092: 
 2093: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2094: daemon_replace_options_algs_conf_file(Config) ->
 2095:     SysDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 2096:     UserDir = proplists:get_value(user_dir, Config),
 2097: 
 2098:     DefaultKex =
 2099:         ssh_transport:default_algorithms(kex),
 2100:     NonDefaultKex =
 2101:         ssh_transport:supported_algorithms(kex) -- DefaultKex,
 2102: 
 2103:     case NonDefaultKex of
 2104:         [A0,A1|_] ->
 2105:             %% Make config file:
 2106:             {ok,ConfFile} =
 2107:                 make_config_file_in_privdir(
 2108:                   "c4.config", Config,
 2109:                   [{ssh, [{modify_algorithms,
 2110:                            %% Whatever happens, always put A0 first in the kex list:
 2111:                            [{prepend, [{kex, [A0]}]}
 2112:                            ]}
 2113:                          ]}
 2114:                   ]),
 2115: 
 2116:             [A2|_] = DefaultKex,
 2117:             ct:log("[A0, A1, A2] = ~p", [[A0, A1, A2]]),
 2118: 
 2119:             %% Start the slave node with the configuration just made:
 2120:             {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["-config", ConfFile]),
 2121: 
 2122:             %% Start ssh on the slave. This should apply the ConfFile:
 2123:             rpc:call(Node, ssh, start, []),
 2124: 
 2125:             {Pid, _Host, _Port} =
 2126:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh_test_lib, daemon,
 2127:                          [
 2128:                           [{system_dir, SysDir},
 2129:                            {user_dir, UserDir},
 2130:                            {preferred_algorithms,[{kex,[A1]}]}
 2131:                           ]
 2132:                          ]),
 2133: 
 2134:             [A0,A1] =
 2135:                 rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, get_preferred_algorithms, [Pid, kex]),
 2136:             {ok, Pid} =
 2137:                 rpc:call(Node, ssh, daemon_replace_options,
 2138:                          [Pid,
 2139:                           [{modify_algorithms,
 2140:                             [{prepend,[{kex,[A2]}]}]
 2141:                            }
 2142:                           ]
 2143:                          ]),
 2144: 
 2145:             %% Check that the precedens order is fulfilled:
 2146:             [A2,A0,A1] =
 2147:                 rpc:call(Node, ?MODULE, get_preferred_algorithms, [Pid, kex]),
 2148: 
 2149:             peer:stop(Peer);
 2150:         [] ->
 2151:             {skip, "No non-default kex"}
 2152:     end.
 2153: 
 2154: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2155: %% Internal functions ------------------------------------------------
 2156: %%--------------------------------------------------------------------
 2157: 
 2158: expected_ssh_vsn(Str) ->
 2159:     try
 2160: 	{ok,L} = application:get_all_key(ssh),
 2161: 	proplists:get_value(vsn,L,"")++"\r\n"
 2162:     of
 2163: 	Str -> true;
 2164: 	"\r\n" -> true;
 2165: 	_ -> false
 2166:     catch
 2167: 	_:_ -> true %% ssh not started so we don't know
 2168:     end.
 2169: 	    
 2170: 
 2171: fake_daemon(_Config) ->
 2172:     Parent = self(),
 2173:     %% start the server
 2174:     Server = spawn(fun() ->
 2175: 			   {ok,Sl} = gen_tcp:listen(0,[{packet,line}]),
 2176: 			   {ok,{Host,Port}} = inet:sockname(Sl),
 2177: 			   ct:log("fake_daemon listening on ~p:~p~n",[Host,Port]),
 2178: 			   Parent ! {sockname,self(),Host,Port},
 2179: 			   Rsa = gen_tcp:accept(Sl),
 2180: 			   ct:log("Server gen_tcp:accept got ~p",[Rsa]),
 2181: 			   {ok,S} = Rsa,
 2182: 			   receive
 2183: 			       {tcp, S, Id} -> Parent ! {id,self(),Id}
 2184: 			   after 
 2185: 			       10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2186: 			   end
 2187: 		   end),
 2188:     %% Get listening host and port
 2189:     receive
 2190: 	{sockname,Server,ServerHost,ServerPort} -> {Server, ServerHost, ServerPort}
 2191:     after 
 2192: 	10000 -> ct:fail("timeout ~p:~p",[?MODULE,?LINE])
 2193:     end.
 2194: 
 2195: 
 2196: make_config_file_in_privdir(FileName, Config, Contents) ->
 2197:     %% write the file:
 2198:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
 2199:     ConfFile = filename:join(PrivDir, FileName),
 2200:     {ok,D} = file:open(ConfFile, [write]),
 2201:     io:format(D, "~p.~n", [Contents]),
 2202:     file:close(D),
 2203:     {ok,Cnfs} = file:read_file(ConfFile),
 2204:     ct:log("Config file ~p :~n~s", [ConfFile,Cnfs]),
 2205:     {ok,ConfFile}.
 2206: 
 2207: 
 2208: get_preferred_algorithms(Pid, Type) ->
 2209:     {ok,#{preferred_algorithms:=As}} = ssh_system_sup:get_acceptor_options(Pid),
 2210:     proplists:get_value(Type, As).
 2211: 
 2212: test_connection(C) ->
 2213:     {ok, Ch} = ssh_connection:session_channel(C, infinity),
 2214:     A = rand:uniform(100),
 2215:     B = rand:uniform(100),
 2216:     A_plus_B = lists:concat([A,"+",B,"."]),
 2217:     Sum = integer_to_binary(A+B),
 2218:     success = ssh_connection:exec(C, Ch, A_plus_B, infinity),
 2219:     expected = ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_result(
 2220:                  {ssh_cm, C, {data, Ch, 0, Sum}} ),
 2221:     ssh_test_lib:receive_exec_end(C, Ch),
 2222:     ok.
 2223: 
 2224: test_not_connect(Config, Host, Port, Opts) ->
 2225:     try
 2226:         ssh_test_lib:std_connect(Config, Host, Port, Opts)
 2227:     of
 2228:         Cx when is_pid(Cx) -> {error, connected}
 2229:     catch
 2230:         error:{badmatch, {error,_}} -> ok
 2231:     end.
 2232:
